newsitem.title: USA: British Air, AMR seen scaling linkup - WSJ.
newsitem.headline: British Air, AMR seen scaling linkup - WSJ.

text.p: British Airways Plc and AMR Corp's American Airlines are preparing for the prospect of a scaled-down alliance amid regulatory resistance, the Wall Street Journal said on Monday, citing people close to the situation.
The newspaper said in its electronic edition that although both airlines voice public optimism that a broad alliance can proceed, they are mapping out contingencies for a looser linkup.
Guy Kekwick, aviation analyst at Goldman, Sachs in London, said the pared-down allience the companies are now preparing "falls way short of what they initially announced."
A decision by the airlines on how to proceed is expected around mid-October, the paper said.
